title: Design of Adaptive Feedback-Enhanced Virtual Field Learning in Earth Science: Integrating Mathematical Modeling and Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in the relevant field or equivalent experience, foundational statistics and graph interpretation skills, and equation comprehension
context.additional_context: Provides alternative learning models for students facing geographical/environmental constraints. Emphasizes geological structure simulations via mathematical modeling and probability-based data analysis.

learning_goals: Utilize mathematical measurement tools (coordinate systems, triangulation, etc.) in a virtual field learning platform to identify and graph five major geological structures (folds, faults, joints, etc.) with 80% accuracy.
Analyze field survey data (stratum thickness, rock distribution) using statistical and probabilistic models via an adaptive feedback system and submit reports in equation-based formats.
Collaborate with peers to conduct at least three virtual field case studies, enhancing data interpretation and scientific discussion skills.

resources: Offline Collaboration Tools (Sticky Notes, Whiteboard, etc.)
Basic Geological Survey Kit (Magnifying Glass, Compass)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
